image.altText: The back of a man's blue shirt

props.synopsis: Taxpayers have funded $1.6 million in payments to the firefighters union via Fire Rescue Victoria, court documents allege, under an income protection scheme the state's fire chief has said should outrage all Victorians.

title.children: Victoria's fire authority sues firefighters union over taxpayer funds

image.altText: A person in Winter gear walking over a bridge.

props.synopsis: Temperatures in the Victorian capital are unlikely to climb past 17 degrees on Christmas Day, but the state will swing back to some warm to hot days ahead of the new year.

title.children: Santa set to deliver Melbourne's coldest Christmas in 20 years

image.altText: Blue ski boat racing on the a river with Superman logos

props.synopsis: One past Southern 80 winner and record holder wonders if the race will ever return.

title.children: Southern 80 water ski race cancelled for second year straight

image.altText: A red and white chopper with a blue strip hovers over a cliff top above an ocean.

props.synopsis: The teenager suffered leg injuries after falling three metres from a clifftop on the Mornington Peninsula.

title.children: Injured boy rescued after falling off cliff at Sorrento

image.altText: A tent pitched near a river.

props.synopsis: Unattended caravans line a popular Murray River campsite, triggering debate over whether public camping spots are being quietly claimed ahead of the busy holiday season.

title.children: Unattended caravans 'ghost camping' at free sites spark debate over fair access

image.altText: A computer generated image of wind turbines inside a pine plantation

props.synopsis: The Victorian government says the wind farm's 33 turbines will generate enough electricity to power more than 130,000 homes.

title.children: New-look electricity commission takes on Victoria's Delburn wind farm

image.altText: Police forensics officers outside a house.

props.synopsis: A man died after he was stabbed during an altercation in Clyde, in Melbourne's south-east. Just hours later another man was fatally stabbed in Fitzroy.

title.children: Police investigate two fatal stabbings in Melbourne

image.altText: A man and two women stand behind a microphone in front of the Victorian, Australian, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags

props.synopsis: In the wake of last week's terrorist attack at Bondi Beach, Premier Jacinta Allan unveils a five-point plan targeting antisemitism in Victoria and providing a "pathway to normal" for the state's Jewish community.

title.children: Victorian government to crack down on hate speech, review gun laws

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios waves his racquet with his right hand at the Brisbane International.

props.synopsis: After a career-best year, Queenslander Priscilla Hon was among four Australian Open wildcards named on Monday, but Nick Kyrgios was not among them.

title.children: Kyrgios not offered Australian Open wildcard — yet

image.altText: Nathan Lyon on crutches after the Adelaide Oval Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: West Australian fast bowler Jhye Richardson comes into Australia's squad for the fourth Ashes Test, while Victorian off spinner Todd Murphy has been named, and is a chance to play his eighth match and first on Australian soil.

title.children: Australia names Boxing Day Ashes replacements for Cummins and Lyon

image.altText: Greyhound trainer in a fluoro vest being interviewed on a race track

props.synopsis: Victorian trainer Gerry Orr has received a six-year ban for procuring performance-enhancing drugs after he inadvertently alerted stewards by giving authorities his mobile phone.

title.children: Greyhound trainer banned after investigator finds messages to 'Anabolic Jim'

image.altText: Cooper Scott wears glasses and a grey jumper and has a serious expression

props.synopsis: Victorian teachers say they are exhausted, living almost 100 kilometres from work, as their salaries fail to sustain housing costs.

title.children: Calls for change to help Victorian teachers put a roof over their heads

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man wearing a dark shirt with a stencil of a house on it, smiling with his thumbs up

props.synopsis: Since 2017, Melbourne building boss Mike Harris has overseen four company collapses. Left behind are clients who have lost their life savings and staff who couldn't pay their mortgages.

title.children: As a building company collapses, clients want to know 'where the money went'

image.altText: Two police officers carrying machine guns

props.synopsis: Officers from the Critical Incident Response Team armed with long-arm weapons will patrol outside the MCG during the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

title.children: Heavily armed specialist police to patrol the MCG during Boxing Day Test

image.altText: Jenny stands smiling holding up a big canvas with a portrait of herself on it, a woman with short white hair and glasses

props.synopsis: Jenny Croom put her art on hold for her family; now the 77-year-old has been crowned Australia's 2025 Portrait Artist of the Year.

title.children: Jenny thought this art competition was a scam — then she won the whole thing

image.altText: Gary Driscoll stands next to his 1-million kilometre LandCruiser in the Horsham Toyota dealership.

props.synopsis: A Victorian stock agent's four-wheel drive LandCruiser has reached a rare milestone, as experts say Australians are keeping their cars longer than ever.

title.children: After a million kilometres, stock agent retires LandCruiser 4WD

image.altText: A woman in a blue top laughing outside on a rooftop in a city.

props.synopsis: Artists like Stella Donnelly are searching for ways to cut waste and make production of their albums environmentally friendly.

title.children: Vinyl's dirty secret: Why your records hurt the planet

image.altText: An older lady in red standing next to a rose bush with her daughter with brown hair behind her

props.synopsis: The small Victorian town of Ouyen, 440 kilometres north-west of Melbourne, is known for its grain and sheep farms, but also for being "dementia friendly".

title.children: When Helen's late mum became lost or forgetful, her community helped

image.altText: Big hailstones in the front yard of a home in Victoria's north.

props.synopsis: Victorians are being urged to brace for destructive storms on Sunday afternoon, with intense rainfall and damaging winds forecast in the state's north while an extreme fire warning remains in place for the north-west.

title.children: 'A big storm day': Tornadoes possible as wild weather hits Victoria

image.altText: An aerial view of a blue building, which is a surf club, behind scrub and a wall of sandbags, with the ocean in front.

props.synopsis: Most Australians live by the beach, but the coastline we have built our lives around is disappearing before our eyes.

title.children: The fight to save Australia's disappearing beaches

image.altText: Joan Jeffery smiles next to her horse Ribana

props.synopsis: While many people entering their 80s are struggling with physical or mental limitations, Joan Jeffery still manages to do all the heavy lifting of caring for a horse.

title.children: Approaching her 80th birthday, Joan Jeffery is still riding high

image.altText: a piece of paper is stuck to a shop window with yellow tape

props.synopsis: Shop owners in the northern Victorian town of Swan Hill say they are concerned after a threatening note was left outside a store selling tobacco, demanding the owner "contact the commission".

title.children: Tobacco shop owner 'refuses to cooperate' with police despite shakedown sign

image.altText: A man with a long beard wears a grey cap, glasses and white button up shirt and stands in front of trees, staring.

props.synopsis: The rise in antisemitism in Australia since October 7 has reshaped the way Gaby Silver's family lives. After the Bondi attack, they're even more on edge.

title.children: How life has changed for one Jewish man in Australia

image.altText: Man with glasses smiling wearing tai chi uniform and a Melbourne Demons Football Club hat.

props.synopsis: Jack Yang's immigration lawyer said his chances of staying in Australia were "nearly zero," but Ballarat's tai chi community had other plans.

title.children: The tai chi teacher Ballarat refused to lose has finally won his fight

image.altText: Woman staring at camera while standing next to a window

props.synopsis: In every Australian state and the NT, churches cannot be held vicariously liable for historical child sexual abuse perpetrated by their priests. Grace Tame is leading the charge for change.

title.children: Grace Tame fights against a legal loophole frustrating abuse survivors

image.altText: A group of women wearing Australian Rules black guernseys with blue V shapes are running onto the field

props.synopsis: Melbourne University is the latest women’s Aussie Rules club fighting for survival, but it is hoping intervention from an AFL executive can turn the club’s fortunes around.

title.children: Why this 'powerhouse' of women's Aussie Rules is at risk of folding

image.altText: Father Christmas walking out to have a swim

props.synopsis: Australia is experiencing a smorgasbord of wild weather in the lead-up to Christmas, featuring extreme heat, humidity, severe thunderstorms, and tropical storms all on the cards.

title.children: Extreme heat, humidity and storms ahead of Christmas Day

image.altText: A burned truck on a burne out area

props.synopsis: A Country Fire Authority crew was forced to call for help after their tanker broke down while fighting an emergency level blaze near Benalla.

title.children: Multiple fire trucks broke down during emergency level blaze in Victoria

image.altText: Damien Richardson.

props.synopsis: Damien Richardson agreed to a restorative justice program, which will require him to apologise to the Jewish community and attend therapy.

title.children: Ex-Neighbours star Damien Richardson sentenced over Nazi gesture

image.altText: A police vehicle parked in front of a house with a grey tin roof, white weatherboard and white fencing.

props.synopsis: Jodie Hill wept as a Supreme Court jury found her not guilty of murder and manslaughter, follow a week of deliberations.

title.children: Regional Victorian found not guilty of murder walks free despite jail cell admission

image.altText: Jacinta Allan and her husband Yorick Piper smile with an AEC volunteer in a voting booth

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has apologised after her husband was caught drink driving, saying the incident left her "disappointed and embarrassed".

title.children: Victorian premier's husband caught drink driving

image.altText: People walking horses away from the fire in a dusty paddock

props.synopsis: One house and six sheds have been lost in a fire started by farm machinery at Goomalibee, near north-east Victorian town Benalla.

title.children: House lost in fire sparked by harvest machinery

image.altText: Chris Scott looks on before the 2025 AFL grand final

props.synopsis: Already the longest serving coach in Geelong history, Chris Scott's new deal with the club will put him in the company of some of the AFL's greatest ever mentors.

title.children: History beckons for Scott after new deal

image.altText: A short white pony wearing a Christmas hat receives pats from a blonde woman.

props.synopsis: A Welsh Shetland cross pony is spreading festive cheer — and stirring memories — during visits to an aged care home in eastern Victoria.

title.children: Pony brings Christmas cheer to aged care home

image.altText: Green Kenworth truck driving alongside parked suburban cars in a town.

props.synopsis: A western Victorian council says plans for a bypass might finally eventuate, as thousands of trucks travel through the city of Horsham each day amid an industrial boom.

title.children: Victorian council hopes bypass might finally happen after 80-year wait
